column4: try ctrl-alt-f2  to drop to terminal  usually any bootable cd can be used as a rescue disk... depending what you need to do
ctrl-alt-f7 returns from that
all i get is cmd prompt
not a root prompt?
yeah, but what am i supposed to do from that
anything you want :]  what do you need to do
reinstall grub
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RecoveringUbuntuAfterInstallingWindows
that says i have to use the rescue thing tho
and my cd won't let me
no that's a different section.  look at the "using the livecd" section
i put in root (hd1,1)
and it says filesystem type unknown
,partition type 0x93
is that your ubuntu boot partition?
yes
i'm not competent to assist with grub troubleshooting, perhaps some other kind soul will take over from here...
thx ill give it a shot :O
you're sure that's where your linux /boot resides?
take a look at the drive numbers in your /boot/grub/menu.lst  :]
if it's root(1,1) i dunno what to tell you :/
yeah it is :/
google sez grub bug may change partition type to 0x93 - you can fix with fdisk maybe?  don't wipe your drive 8-O
